body: Could you post the `alacritty --print-events` log when pressing said not working combination?
Could you please press for me `Alt + y`, `Alt + Ctrl + y`, `Alt + Win + y` (could some other key if it triggers something in windows), and `Alt + Shift + Ctrl + y` and other combination?

@kchibisov Hello ~ Alacritty is amazing, thanks for all your hard work! There might still be some remaining feature work to patch this `ctrl+alt` problem on Windows? Else I apologize if this is just a misconfig with my machine. **=== Using ===** - Windows 11 - `alacritty 0.13.1 (fe2a3c5)` [[release](https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/releases/tag/v0.13.1)] **=== Issue ===** ❌ I'm still unable to use any Ctrl+Alt+`[a-z]` hotkeys in Alacritty **=== Details ===** **Good news...** - ✅ Using Alacritty I can use... - ✅ Ctrl+Alt+Insert - ✅ Ctrl+Alt+Delete - ✅ Ctrl+Alt+Home - ✅ Ctrl+Alt+End - ✅ Ctrl+Alt+PgUp - ✅ Ctrl+Alt+PgDn - and - ✅ Ctrl+Alt+FN keys (F1 through F12 work with ctrl+alt) **Bad news...** Using Alacritty + WSL2 using `showkey -a` : - ❌ Ctrl+Alt+a through Ctrl+Alt+z fails to display any output - (however it looks like `alacritty --print-events` is correctly detecting the modifiers + a-z keys being pressed and released -- I pasted the logs below) - running WSL2 through Powershell -> this works fine Using Alacritty + Powershell to run a Python script which is capable of surfacing a `ctrl+alt+[a-z]` response in other terminal emulators : - ❌ Ctrl+Alt+a through Ctrl+Alt+z fails to display any output - (same as above, seems like the events are in the debug log, just not reaching the app)
---- ### === Tests on my machine === #### Test 1: Alacritty + WSL2 + `showkey -a` ✅ `a` works ✅ `ctrl` + `a` works ✅ `alt` + `a` works ✅ `ctrl` + `alt` + `a` shows up in the `alacritty --print-events` logs ❌ `ctrl` + `alt` + `a` displays nothing in the terminal
Test 1: Video https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/assets/65138515/fbd03a05-4a88-4edd-8f73-3d6da3b620d7
Test 1: Logs [2024-03-17 21-19-44 (just beginning).logs.txt](https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/files/14630692/2024-03-17.21-19-44.just.beginning.logs.txt)

#### Test 2: Alacritty + Powershell + python ✅ `a` works ✅ `ctrl` + `a` works ✅ `alt` + `a` works ✅ `ctrl` + `alt` + `a` shows up in the `alacritty --print-events` logs (same as above) ❌ `ctrl` + `alt` + `a` displays nothing in the terminal
Test 2: Video -- Alacritty + Powershell + Python script https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/assets/65138515/92315a0f-8545-4c3e-b499-e26126fa814b

#### Test 3: (**No Alacritty**) Plain Powershell + python ✅ `a` works ✅ `ctrl` + `a` works ✅ `alt` + `a` works ✅ `ctrl` + `alt` + `a` shows up in the `alacritty --print-events` logs (same as above) ✅ `ctrl` + `alt` + `a` outputs as expected (same for all other `ctrl+alt+[a-z]` and fn keys)
Test 3: Video -- Proof it works in plain Powershell (not using Alacritty) https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/assets/65138515/b70903a8-4886-41ca-8faa-7cc922b109bb

#### Test 4: (**No Alacritty**) Plain Powershell + WSL2 ctrl+alt+a works fine in `showkey -a` within WSL2 using Powershell (no Alacritty): ![image](https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/assets/65138515/01ed0d1d-2ed8-44e2-95b2-89abf9994020)


---- ### **=== Supplemental ===** #### Python raw input script
Python script (if anyone needs to test) Using a modified version of the example here: https://blessed.readthedocs.io/en/1.20.0/keyboard.html#inkey ```python #-------------------- # pip install blessed #-------------------- # keyboard_raw.py #-------------------- import blessed term = blessed.Terminal() print(f"{term.home}{term.black_on_skyblue}{term.clear}") print("press 'q' to quit.") with term.raw(): val = '' while val.lower() != 'q': val = term.inkey() if val == chr(19): print(f'got ctrl+s, val: {val}') if not val: pass # print("It sure is quiet in here ...") elif val.is_sequence: # print("got sequence: {0}.".format((str(val), val.name, val.code, ord(val)))) # print("got sequence: {0}.".format((str(val), val.name, val.code))) val_str = val if len(val) == 1: val_str = str(val).__repr__() else: val_str = '{0}'.format( (str(val),) ) print( "got sequence: " + f'str(val): {val_str} \t' + f'val.name: {val.name} \t' + f'val.code: {val.code} \t' + str( f'ord(val): {ord(val) if len(val) == 1 else None}' ) + "." ) elif val: print( "got {0}.\t".format(val) + f'val.name:{val.name} \t' + f'val.code: {val.code} \t' + f'ord(val): {ord(val)}' ) print("\r", end='', flush=True) print(f'bye!{term.normal}') ```

#### Alacritty config Here's my `alacritty.toml` -- but I still have this issue even when I delete all `alacritty.toml` configs.
alacritty.toml ```ini #-------------------------------------------- # https://alacritty.org/config-alacritty.html # https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty #-------------------------------------------- # shell = "C:\\Windows\\System32\\bash.exe" # working_directory = "C://1dir/Code/repo/gamepad-coder/grid" [window] # decorations = "Full" # decorations = "None" # dynamic_padding = true decorations = "Full" padding = { x = 10, y = 10 } # option_as_alt = "OnlyLeft" [font] normal = { family = "Consolas", style = "Regular" } #normal = { family = "Noto Color Emoji", style = "Regular" } #normal = { family = "Cascadia Mono", style = "Regular" } #normal = { family = "Consolas", style = "Regular" } #normal = { family = "Noto Color Emoji", style = "Regular" } size = 20 offset = {x=0, y=0} [colors] # selection = { text = "#000000", background = "#000000" } [colors.normal] black = '#0c0c0c' red = '#c50f1f' #green = '#13a10e' # what I'm using in Hyper to match WT green = '#16c60c' # closer fit yellow = '#c19c00' #blue = '#0037da' # what I'm using in Hyper to match WT blue = '#3b78ff' # closer fit -- used color picker :) magenta = '#881798' cyan = '#3a96dd' white = '#cccccc' [colors.bright] black = '#767676' red = '#e74856' green = '#16c60c' yellow = '#f9f1a5' blue = '#3b78ff' magenta = '#b4009e' cyan = '#61d6d6' white = '#f2f2f2' [cursor] style = { shape = "Block", blinking = "On" } [keyboard] bindings = [ #----------------------------------------------------------------------- # default keybinds: https://alacritty.org/config-alacritty-bindings.html #----------------------------------------------------------------------- # ============== KEY BINDINGS ================================================================= { key = "PageUp", mods = "Shift", mode = "~Alt" , action = "ReceiveChar"}, { key = "PageDown", mods = "Shift", mode = "~Alt" , action = "ReceiveChar"}, { key = "Home", mods = "Shift", mode = "~Alt" , action = "ReceiveChar"}, { key = "End", mods = "Shift", mode = "~Alt" , action = "ReceiveChar"}, # ============== Vi Mode ====================================================================== { key = "Space", mods = "Shift", mode = "~Alt" , action = "ReceiveChar"}, { key = "Space", mods = "Shift|Control", action = "ReceiveChar"}, { key = "Space", mods = "Control", chars = "\u0000"}, { key = "Space", mods = "Control|Shift", chars = "\u0000"}, # ============== Windows, Linux, and BSD only ================================================= #{ key = "V", mods = "Control|Shift", action = "ReceiveChar"}, #{ key = "C", mods = "Control|Shift", action = "ReceiveChar"}, { key = "F", mods = "Control|Shift", action = "ReceiveChar"}, { key = "B", mods = "Control|Shift", action = "ReceiveChar"}, { key = "Insert", mods = "Shift", action = "ReceiveChar"}, { key = "Insert", mods = "Control|Shift", action = "ReceiveChar"}, #------------------------------ # going to keep zoom hotkeys :3 #------------------------------ # { key = "Enter", mods = "Alt", action = "ReceiveChar"}, # { key = "0", mods = "Control", action = "ReceiveChar"}, # { key = "=", mods = "Control", action = "ReceiveChar"}, # { key = "+", mods = "Control", action = "ReceiveChar"}, # { key = "-", mods = "Control", action = "ReceiveChar"}, # { key = "NumpadAdd", mods = "Control", action = "ReceiveChar"}, # { key = "NumpadSubtract", mods = "Control", action = "ReceiveChar"}, { key = "q", mods = "Control", mode="Alt", chars = "test"}, { key = "q", mods = "Alt|Control", chars = "test"}, { key = "Tab", mods = "Control", action = "ReceiveChar"}, { key = "Tab", mods = "Control|Shift", action = "ReceiveChar"}, ] ```

### Test 1: Logs

The logs for Test 1 exceeded the character limit for a GitHub comment, so I attached the full excerpt as a text file in the previous comment.

In this comment I'll repost just the <kbd>ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>alt</kbd>+<kbd>b</kbd> logs from the txt file above.

#### Screenshot 

![Screenshot 2024-03-17 231300](https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/assets/65138515/e18bee45-98c7-433f-9981-0b6dc09e060a)

#### ctrl+alt+b logs

<details>

I have the same problem as @gamepad-coder on Windows 11 with Alacritty 0.15.1. Did I miss something important in `alacritty.toml`, except for the following configurations?

```toml
[keyboard]
```

> [@kchibisov](https://github.com/kchibisov) Hello ~
> 
> Alacritty is amazing, thanks for all your hard work!
> 
> There might still be some remaining feature work to patch this `ctrl+alt` problem on Windows? Else I apologize if this is just a misconfig with my machine.
> 
> **=== Using ===**
> 
> * Windows 11
> * `alacritty 0.13.1 (fe2a3c5)` [[release](https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/releases/tag/v0.13.1)]
> 
> **=== Issue ===** ❌ I'm still unable to use any Ctrl+Alt+`[a-z]` hotkeys in Alacritty
> 
> **=== Details ===**
> 
> **Good news...**
> 
> * ✅  Using Alacritty I can use...
>   
>   * ✅ Ctrl+Alt+Insert
>   * ✅ Ctrl+Alt+Delete
>   * ✅ Ctrl+Alt+Home
>   * ✅ Ctrl+Alt+End
>   * ✅ Ctrl+Alt+PgUp
>   * ✅ Ctrl+Alt+PgDn
>   * and
>   * ✅ Ctrl+Alt+FN keys (F1 through F12 work with ctrl+alt)
> 
> **Bad news...**
> 
> Using Alacritty + WSL2 using `showkey -a` :
> 
> * ❌ Ctrl+Alt+a through Ctrl+Alt+z fails to display any output
>   
>   * (however it looks like `alacritty --print-events` is correctly detecting the modifiers + a-z keys being pressed and released -- I pasted the logs below)
>   * running WSL2 through Powershell -> this works fine
> 
> Using Alacritty + Powershell to run a Python script which is capable of surfacing a `ctrl+alt+[a-z]` response in other terminal emulators :
> 
> * ❌ Ctrl+Alt+a through Ctrl+Alt+z fails to display any output
>   
>   * (same as above, seems like the events are in the debug log, just not reaching the app)
> 
>

> ✅ `a` works ✅ `ctrl` + `a` works ✅ `alt` + `a` works ✅ `ctrl` + `alt` + `a` shows up in the `alacritty --print-events` logs ❌ `ctrl` + `alt` + `a` displays nothing in the terminal
